events.originalText: Seven members of Parliament in the United Kingdom resigned from the Labour Party to form a new political party called The Independent Group.
events.subtitle: Member of Parliament (United Kingdom)
events.headline: Seven UK MPs Resign from Labour Party to Form The Independent Group

events.originalText: A series of violent events (pictured) involving protesters, riot police, and unknown shooters began in Kyiv that culminated in the ousting of Ukrainian president Viktor Yanukovych five days later.
events.subtitle: Revolution of Dignity
events.headline: Violent Events in Kyiv Lead to Ousting of Ukrainian President Yanukovych

events.originalText: Eight gunmen stole US$50,000,000 worth of diamonds from a Swiss-bound aircraft at Brussels Airport.
events.subtitle: Brussels Airport diamond heist
events.headline: Eight Gunmen Steal $50M Worth of Diamonds from Brussels Airport

events.originalText: In a coup d'état, military rebels attacked the presidential palace in Niamey, Niger, and replaced President Mamadou Tandja with a ruling junta, the Supreme Council for the Restoration of Democracy.
events.subtitle: 2010 Nigerien coup d'état
events.headline: Military Rebels Attack Presidential Palace in Niamey, Niger

events.originalText: WikiLeaks published the first of hundreds of thousands of classified documents disclosed by Chelsea Manning.
events.subtitle: WikiLeaks
events.headline: WikiLeaks Publishes Classified Documents Disclosed by Chelsea Manning

events.originalText: American FBI agent Robert Hanssen (pictured) was arrested for having spied for the KGB and GRU over a 22-year period.
events.subtitle: Federal Bureau of Investigation
events.headline: FBI Agent Robert Hanssen Arrested for Spying for KGB and GRU

events.originalText: Inter-ethnic violence between the Dayak and the Madurese broke out in Sampit, Indonesia, ultimately causing more than 500 deaths and the displacement of 100,000 Madurese from their homes.
events.subtitle: Sampit conflict
events.headline: Inter-Ethnic Violence in Sampit, Indonesia Causes 500+ Deaths

events.originalText: NASA's first Space Shuttle, Enterprise, made its first test flight on top of the Shuttle Carrier Aircraft (both pictured).
events.subtitle: NASA
events.headline: NASA's Space Shuttle Enterprise Makes First Test Flight

events.originalText: The Xinjiang 61st Regiment Farm fire started during Chinese New Year when a firecracker ignited the wreaths of late Mao Zedong, killing 694 personnel.
events.subtitle: Xinjiang 61st Regiment Farm fire
events.headline: Xinjiang 61st Regiment Farm Fire Kills 694 Personnel

events.originalText: President Harry S. Truman signed the Rescission Act, annulling benefits payable to Filipino troops who fought for the U.S. during World War II.
events.subtitle: Harry S. Truman
events.headline: Truman Signs Rescission Act Annulling Benefits for Filipino Troops

events.originalText: Joseph Goebbels, the Nazi propaganda minister, delivered a speech calling for a "total war" to motivate the German people as the tide of World War II turned against Germany.
events.subtitle: Joseph Goebbels
events.headline: Nazi Propaganda Minister Goebbels Calls for 'Total War'

events.originalText: The core members of the White Rose, an anti-Nazi resistance group, were arrested by the Gestapo.
events.subtitle: White Rose
events.headline: Anti-Nazi Resistance Group White Rose Members Arrested by Gestapo

events.originalText: Competition between two American merchants in Lincoln County, New Mexico Territory, turned into a range war when a member of one faction was murdered by the other.
events.subtitle: Lincoln County, New Mexico
events.headline: Competition in Lincoln County Turns into Range War

events.originalText: Vasil Levski, a national hero of Bulgaria, was executed in Sofia by the Ottoman authorities for his efforts to establish an independent Bulgarian republic.
events.subtitle: Vasil Levski
events.headline: Bulgarian National Hero Vasil Levski Executed by Ottoman Authorities

events.originalText: War of the Sixth Coalition: French troops led by Napoleon forced the Army of Bohemia to retreat after it advanced dangerously close to Paris.
events.subtitle: War of the Sixth Coalition
events.headline: French Troops Force Army of Bohemia to Retreat in War of Sixth Coalition

events.originalText: Fourth Anglo-Dutch War: A British expedition against Dutch colonial outposts on the Gold Coast of Africa landed in Elmina in present-day Ghana.
events.subtitle: Fourth Anglo-Dutch War
events.headline: British Expedition Lands in Elmina, Ghana in Fourth Anglo-Dutch War

events.originalText: Enslaved Malagasy captives on the Dutch East India Company slave ship Meermin began a mutiny that led to the ship's destruction on Cape Agulhas in present-day South Africa and the recapture of the instigators.
events.subtitle: Malagasy peoples
events.headline: Enslaved Malagasy Captives Mutiny on Dutch East India Company Ship Meermin

events.originalText: Eighty Years' War: Off the coast of Cornwall, a Spanish fleet intercepted an Anglo-Dutch merchant convoy of forty-four vessels escorted by six men-of-war, destroying or capturing twenty ships.
events.subtitle: Eighty Years' War
events.headline: Spanish Fleet Intercepts Anglo-Dutch Merchant Convoy off Cornwall

events.originalText: The Battle of Wesenberg took place between Novgorodian and Pskovian forces against the Livonian Order and its allies, ending with Russian forces retreating from Danish Estonia.
events.subtitle: Battle of Wesenberg (1268)
events.headline: Battle of Wesenberg Ends with Russian Forces Retreating

events.originalText: According to Hindu scriptures, Kali Yuga, the last of the four stages that the world goes through as part of the cycle of yugas, began.
events.subtitle: 4th millennium BC
events.headline: Kali Yuga Begins According to Hindu Scriptures
